big_picture: Today's policy news highlights key developments in India's cybersecurity landscape, with Union Minister Amit Shah chairing a consultative committee meeting on cybercrime. Prime Minister Narendra Modi's 2-day visit to Israel has begun, receiving a red carpet welcome, amidst criticism from the Congress party over his relationship with Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu. Meanwhile, Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman has cautioned against premature assessment of the impact of US tariff changes on India, while the Delhi High Court has sought responses from the Centre and National Crime Records Bureau on a plea challenging the law allowing police to collect DNA and biometric data of accused individuals.

articles.title: SC Dismisses IBC Challenge to Benami Attachment Because NCLT Lacks Jurisdiction
articles.summary: The Supreme Court dismissed a challenge to Benami attachment under the Benami Act, ruling that insolvency tribunals lack jurisdiction. This decision affects the Insolvency and Bankruptcy Code (IBC) and the Benami Act. The ruling has significant implications for asset confiscation and insolvency proceedings in India.
articles.raw_summary: Supreme Court held that attachment orders under the Benami Act cannot be challenged before NCLT under IBC, as the Act provides an exclusive adjudicatory mechanism. Insolvency tribunals cannot review sovereign confiscation proceedings. The post SC Dismisses IBC Challenge to Benami Attachment Because NCLT Lacks Jurisdiction appeared first on TaxGuru .

articles.title: GST on Pure Services to Statutory Authorities After Circular 245/2025
articles.summary: The Indian government has clarified the GST exemption for services provided to statutory authorities. The exemption is available only if the services are pure, provided to eligible government bodies, and linked to constitutional functions. This clarification aims to provide clarity on GST exemptions for government bodies.
articles.raw_summary: GST exemption is available only if services are pure, provided to eligible government bodies, and linked to constitutional functions. All three conditions must be strictly satisfied. The post GST on Pure Services to Statutory Authorities After Circular 245/2025 appeared first on TaxGuru .

articles.summary: The U.S. Department of Commerce (Commerce) has announced its preliminary determination of countervailing duties of up to 125.87% on crystalline silicon solar cells, whether or not assembled into modules, imported from India. Commerce had initiated anti-dumping duty (AD) and countervailing duty (CVD) investigations in August 2025.

articles.title: India bond rally halts for RBI outcome; traders eye liquidity measures
articles.summary: Indian government bonds held steady on Friday. Investors await the Reserve Bank of India's monetary policy decision. While a repo rate cut is unlikely, bondholders seek guidance on liquidity. Banks are urging the RBI to adjust regulations to address a deposit shortfall. The central bank has previously infused significant liquidity into the system.

articles.title: Government Approves Higher Equity Investment Cap for POWERGRID
articles.summary: The Cabinet Committee on Economic Affairs (CCEA) has raised the permissible equity investment limit for Power Grid Corporation of India (POWERGRID) in its subsidiaries to ₹75 billion (~$825.25 million) per subsidiary, up from ₹50 billion (~$550.17 million). However, POWERGRID’s investments in its subsidiaries must not exceed 15% of its net worth. POWERGRID’s equity investment threshold in subsidiaries was raised under the extant guidelines on the delegation of powers applicable to central public

articles.title: Billdesk to acquire Worldline’s India operations; deal values business at $70 million
articles.summary: Billdesk is set to acquire the India payments business of French payment giant Worldline for an estimated equity value of $70 million. In a press release Worldline said that it will be entering into a long-term technology and software pact with Billdesk, through which Worldline’s software stack will continue to remain operational in India. At an enterprise level the value of the deal was pegged at $43.6 million.

articles.title: Delhi-Katra Expressway construction on track, will be completed by March 2027: NHAI
articles.summary: India's fifth major expressway, the Delhi-Amritsar-Katra route, will be ready by March 2027. This project significantly cuts travel time between Delhi and Katra to six hours. It connects Sri Harmandir Sahib in Amritsar and Mata Vaishno Devi shrine in Katra. The expressway will also aid faster military movement near the International Border. Construction faced delays but has now regained momentum.

articles.title: Nepal's soyoil exports to India jump tenfold on duty free access
articles.summary: Nepal's soybean oil exports to India saw a massive jump in 2025. Duty-free access allowed Nepal to send record amounts of refined oil to India. This surge helped Nepal's total exports to India double. However, it created challenges for Indian refiners who pay import duties. Nepal's share of India's soybean oil imports increased significantly.

articles.title: Unlocking Rs 40 lakh crore: Govt's mega bet on India's infra future
articles.summary: Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman launched the National Monetisation Pipeline 2.0, aiming to raise Rs 16.7 lakh crore by monetising over 2,000 assets. This initiative focuses on operating and maintaining brownfield infrastructure for fixed periods, not privatization, to fund new greenfield projects and boost GDP.

articles.title: Fresh math for world's fastest growing economy: What's behind India's GDP revision and why it matters
articles.summary: India's new GDP revision is set to reflect new way of measuring the economy, shifting the base year for GDP to 2022–23. Authorities will also publish revised figures for earlier years to align them with the new benchmark. The goal is to make the numbers more realistic and responsive to today’s economy, including evolving spending patterns and the expansion of online and tech-driven activity.

articles.title: Massive AI capex not a bubble, but software & IT business models at risk: Arvind Sanger
articles.summary: Massive AI investments by US tech giants are unlikely to be a bubble, but could fundamentally disrupt traditional software and IT services, including Indian firms. The real risk lies in business model disruption, potentially impacting pricing and revenue for manpower-heavy IT services.

articles.title: Tariff Turbulence: US policy swings leave Indian exporters racing to adjust
articles.summary: Indian exporters face uncertainty after rapid US tariff shifts. Businesses are adjusting strategies amid fluctuating duties. articles.summary: Dr. Martens established a Global Capability Centre in Bengaluru, India, to merge its heritage with a digital future. articles.summary: The Indian government has revised the External Commercial Borrowings (ECB) framework, allowing more borrowers and lenders to participate. This change eliminates fixed interest rate ceilings and links borrowing limits to a company's financial strength. The revised framework aims to make it easier for Indian companies to access foreign capital.
articles.raw_summary: Revised ECB framework allows broader borrower and lender participation while eliminating fixed interest spread ceilings. Borrowing limits are now linked to financial strength instead of rigid thresholds. The post External Commercial Borrowings: Comparative Analysis of Revised Framework appeared first on TaxGuru .

articles.title: ITC on Leasehold Transfer Not Blocked Credit, Gujarat HC Clarifies Scope of Section 17(5)(d)
articles.summary: The Gujarat High Court clarified that Input Tax Credit (ITC) on charges related to transfer of leasehold rights does not fall within blocked credit under Section 17(5)(d). The court quashed a notice issued under Section 74, ruling that no fraud or suppression was shown. This decision affects businesses and taxpayers in India.
articles.raw_summary: The Court held that ITC on charges related to transfer of leasehold rights does not fall within blocked credit under Section 17(5)(d). As no fraud or suppression was shown, invocation of Section 74 was without jurisdiction and the notice was quashed. The post ITC on Leasehold Transfer Not Blocked Credit, Gujarat HC Clarifies Scope of Section 17(5)(d) appeared first on TaxGuru .

articles.title: Draft Income Tax Rule 32 – Guidelines, Form & Procedure for Approval under Sections 45(4) read with 45(3)(a)
articles.summary: The Indian government has proposed new income tax rules, specifically Rule 32, which outlines procedures and forms for approval under Sections 45(4) and 45(3)(a). This change aims to clarify and streamline the approval process for certain income tax-related matters. The new rules are expected to have a significant impact on taxpayers and tax authorities.
articles.raw_summary: Rule 32 of Draft Income-tax Rules, 2026 sets procedure, Form 17 filing, timelines, scrutiny, approval validity up to 5 years, deficiency process, and withdrawal norms under Section 45(4). articles.title: Draft Income Tax Rule 31 – Statement of Donation Particulars and Donor Certificate Under Section 45(4)(a)
articles.summary: The Indian government has proposed a new income tax rule, Draft Rule 31, which requires research institutions and eligible companies to report donations and issue certificates to donors. This change aims to ensure compliance and prevent deductions without proper reporting. The rule will impact organizations claiming deductions under Section 45(4)(a).

articles.summary: Building foundational AI technology is a necessity rather than an option for India to maintain its digital independence, said Sarvam co-founder, Vivek Raghavan. articles.summary: Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman has launched the National Monetisation Pipeline 2.0, aiming for over Rs 16.7 lakh crore in receipts by 2029-30. articles.title: India and France revise 1992 tax treaty, drop 'most favoured nation' clause
articles.summary: India and France have updated their tax treaty. This revision strengthens tax collection at the source. It also changes rules for dividends and business presence. articles.title: EPFO plans single pool for ETF investments
articles.summary: The Employees' Provident Fund Organisation (EPFO) is set to consolidate its five schemes into a single account for ETF investments, moving from monthly to annual investment cycles. articles.title: Govt plans study to assess impact of formalisation on workers
articles.summary: The government has ordered a study to assess whether rapid formalisation and digitisation are generating durable income and jobs for informal workers. articles.title: What AI can fix in Indian banking, and what it cannot
articles.summary: AI can make Indian banking faster, smarter, and more efficient — but it cannot manufacture trust or consumer-centricity. The real challenge is not technology, but whether institutions and policy can ensure AI serves inclusion and better consumer centricity, rather than scaling indifference, writes Corporate Advisor and Author Dr. Srinath Sridharan.
